spd.explanation: SPD mentions 'good working conditions at schools' but does not explicitly mention higher salaries.

citations.content: SPD: Too few students currently benefit from BAföG. Therefore, more students should gradually have an entitlement for us. In the long term, we want to make BAföG more independent of parents. We are striving for a gradual return to the full subsidy. In addition, the processing times for BAföG applications must be shortened – through further digitization and simplification. We want to continue and increase the successful federal Young Housing programme in order to create affordable housing for trainees and students. In addition, we will provide greater support for dual studies and extend the protective rights of the Vocational Education and Training Act to this training path as well. We want good working conditions at schools and daycare centers. Daycare centers and schools must be attractive places of learning and working with good working conditions. In order to meet the best possible standards for contemporary daycare and school buildings in the many upcoming new buildings and renovations, we therefore want to create more incentives for providers. We want to make the education system fit for the immigration society. Our immigration society needs an education system that opens up all opportunities for children from different backgrounds to attend daycare centers and schools successfully. We also want to reflect diversity in curricula, textbooks and in the pedagogical professions. Students from different backgrounds should be able to identify with them.

volt.explanation: Volt mentions 'good working conditions' and 'fair remuneration' but does not explicitly mention higher salaries.

citations.content: Volt: STRONG EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION – FOR EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH BETTER CARE A comprehensive, child-friendly childcare service is crucial in order to offer all children equal opportunities and to ensure reliable support for parents. Uniform standards, fair working conditions and innovative concepts strengthen the quality of early childhood education and relieve the burden on educational professionals.

Volt: BETTER WORKING CONDITIONS FOR A STRONG EDUCATION Good working conditions in the education system are crucial in order to support educational professionals in their responsibility and to offer learners the best possible support. Multi-professional and practice-oriented teams create the space that young people need to develop into engaged members of society.

Volt: FINANCING OF STUDIES AND TRAINING A fair education system enables all people to develop freely, regardless of their financial situation. We all benefit from lower financial burdens and fair access to training and studies. That's why Volt is committed to this future: •  Remuneration without risk of poverty: The training allowance is sufficient for a decent life and the state closes gaps through targeted, performance-oriented incentives, such as an orientation towards the minimum wage, in order to avoid poverty during training.

Volt: BEST PRACTICE Mentoring Program in Austria – The Induction Phase for Teachers The induction phase supports new teachers with mentoring, reflection and targeted support to make it easier to start their careers. Experienced contact persons offer individual support in lesson design and challenges, while job shadowing, coaching and networking promote professional skills. School principals assess progress and initiate development measures. This model reduces uncertainty, strengthens the quality of teaching and increases job satisfaction. LEAVING THE SCHOOL IN THE VILLAGE – OPPORTUNITIES FOR RURAL AREAS Village schools are essential for vibrant rural regions. They strengthen the community and offer unique educational opportunities that do justice to local conditions.

Volt: Teachers and specialists work closely together to enable holistic care that combines education and social support. That's why Volt is committed to this future: •  Specialists in schools: Specialists in psychology, school social work, school health and special education will become an integral part of the school system.

Volt: Reduced rents for apprentices reduce the financial burden. BEST PRACTICE Free Education in Sweden – A Model for Equal Opportunities In Sweden, educational opportunities from early childhood education to university are free of charge. This creates real equality of opportunity regardless of social background. Support programs such as interest-free loans also enable low-income families to access higher education. The model reduces school drop-out rates, strengthens social cohesion and makes Sweden a pioneer in lifelong learning and economic competitiveness. MORE INCLUSION FOR A DISCRIMINATION-FREE EDUCATION SYSTEM Inclusion must be lived as a matter of course in our education system so that all people can learn together, regardless of individual needs or talents. Needs-oriented and non-discriminatory education strengthens equal opportunities and social cohesion. That's why Volt is committed to this future: •  Individual inclusion budgets: Educational institutions receive funding to implement individual solutions for inclusion.

Volt: FREE EDUCATION FOR MORE EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES AND PARTICIPATION Education is a fundamental right that must be fully accessible to all children and young people. A free education system strengthens equal opportunities and enables participation regardless of financial background. That's why Volt is committed to this future: •  Free learning materials: Learning materials are provided free of charge to school-age children nationwide and financed by federal funds.

fdp.explanation: FDP mentions 'attractive opportunities for advancement' but does not explicitly mention higher salaries.

citations.content: FDP: The present agreement between the federal and state governments is a missed opportunity, because the states are hardly contributing any additional funds. We want to give schools more pedagogical, personnel and financial competences. To this end, everyone is to receive a freely deployable opportunity budget. This allows schools to decide independently on the organisation of educational elements, their school profile, the use of multi-professional teams, but also on personnel decisions and the length of the grammar school career (G8/G9). Modern curricula and excellent teachers Schools need excellent teachers. With more attractive working conditions, practical training and further education, performance-based pay and attractive opportunities for advancement, we want to create more freedom in the teaching profession. We want to develop apprenticeship training nationwide into a dual teacher training program that closely interlinks theory and practice and places a stronger focus on digital and AI skills. A nationwide mobility guarantee is intended to make it easier for teachers to change federal states. At the same time, we want to modernize the curricula: We Free Democrats demand more space for economic and financial education, STEM topics, democracy and politics as well as media literacy. We are particularly committed to the nationwide introduction of the school subjects of economics and computer science.

bsw.explanation: BSW mentions 'attractive working conditions for lateral entrants' but does not explicitly mention higher salaries.

citations.content: BSW: Working conditions in all educational institutions urgently need to be improved. To this end, teachers must be relieved of non-specialist tasks by support teams (social work, school psychologists, IT management). Teacher training should include more practical elements. Dual forms of training that lead to a bachelor's/master's degree followed by a traineeship are conceivable. In the short term, the shortage of teachers can be combated by attractive working conditions for lateral entrants. In recent years, teachers have been increasingly burdened with additional tasks, such as IT management, school organization, and psychological counseling. The formation of support teams for everyday work at schools – social work, IT management, psychological support – can bring about a decisive improvement. The children and young people themselves must be able to perceive daycare centres and schools as safe havens again – without discrimination, bullying or racism – with dignity and recognition. Education does not end in adulthood. Adult education centres must be financially strengthened. The chronic underfunding of universities must be ended.

BSW: More and more young people are leaving school without elementary knowledge. They hardly have a chance on the job market later on. Two-thirds of current recipients of citizen's allowance do not have a vocational qualification, and many do not have a school-leaving certificate either. We need a comprehensive renewal of education policy. This will contribute to the end of small-scale education. Different types of schools as a prerequisite for different later training paths make sense in principle, but social selection according to the parental home is not.

BSW: We want to raise the statutory minimum wage to 15 euros immediately. The minimum wage must be permanently poverty-proof. Future adjustments are to be based on the EU Minimum Wage Directive (60 percent of median income). Mini- and midi-jobs, fixed-term contracts and the abuse of work contracts and temporary work still make it impossible for millions of people to plan their lives reliably. We want to significantly reduce fixed-term contracts with objective reasons. We reject fixed-term contracts without objective reasons and chain fixed-term contracts. These measures are also intended to help close the income gap between men and women. Collective agreements are an important instrument for achieving good wages and working conditions. However, collective bargaining has been in free fall for 25 years, with only 49 per cent of employment contracts still covered by collective bargaining. To achieve this goal, we want to implement a package of measures: Public contracts and subsidies are to be awarded only to companies that pay collectively agreed wages. In addition, we want to make it easier for collective agreements to be declared generally binding.

BSW: In secondary schools, in addition to the acquisition of solid basic knowledge, individual strengths are to become the focus of the training. Every young person must be guaranteed the right to a training place. Strengthening vocational preparation at lower secondary level is just as necessary as upgrading intermediate school leaving certificates and apprenticeships – the "old" master craftsman professions in particular are among our strengths and should continue to be so in the future. With a nationwide internship concept, companies and businesses are to enter into close cooperation with the schools. There is a need for more political education, peace education formats and democracy education in schools in all federal states. In order to solve the shortage of skilled workers in pedagogical professions, states and municipalities must be supported in training more teachers and educators.

afd.explanation: AFD does not explicitly mention higher salaries for teachers.

citations.content: AFD: STRENGTHENING VOCATIONAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING: MORE MASTER CRAFTSMEN INSTEAD OF MASTER'S DEGREES Dual training in companies and vocational schools is a model for success. However, the striving for ever higher Abitur quotas endangers the next generation in the training professions. Numerous apprenticeships cannot be filled due to a lack of sufficiently qualified applicants, and too many apprentices drop out of training. Vocational schools must be strengthened as supporting pillars of vocational education and training and lifelong learning, and the value of vocational education and training must be better appreciated. The lower secondary schools and secondary schools are to become more attractive through cooperation with companies and the chambers of industry and crafts. MIGRATION AND EDUCATION The integration of migrants is a challenge for the German education system, as many of them come from other cultural backgrounds and often from educationally disadvantaged backgrounds. In many cases, a lack of previous education, a lack of language skills and cultural differences prevent successful qualifications for the German labour market. As long as children with a migrant background do not speak sufficient German to participate in regular lessons, compulsory German lessons must be in the foreground.

AFD: In the "woke" society, mothers only count if they are gainfully employed and, if possible, place their children in all-day care when they are babies. Families should be a safe haven and must once again be at the centre of society, both economically and socially.

AFD: Especially in the case of parents who work in two jobs, it is difficult to reconcile work and family. In addition, there are additional child-related costs for housing, care and education, which are only minimally compensated for in the assessment of taxes and social security contributions. Middle-income families in particular are massively burdened by this, so that their birth rate is alarmingly low. After all, fewer and fewer couples are economically able to do parenting work.
AFD: With a childcare salary up to the 3rd birthday, parents should be given real freedom of choice between external and self-care.

cdu.explanation: CDU does not explicitly mention higher salaries for teachers.

citations.content: CDU: It must not be the case that the place of residence is decisive for the quality of education. We rely on meaningful and binding comparative studies and learning status surveys. Our goal is a high-level Abitur that is comparable in quality nationwide. There must be no levelling of requirements. We are pushing ahead with the expansion of all-day educational opportunities for primary school children. Each child should be supported and challenged more individually. One thing is clear: reading, writing and arithmetic are the basis for any educational success.

linke.explanation: Linke does not explicitly mention higher salaries for teachers.

citations.content: Linke: After the training, all trainees are to be taken on by the companies without a probationary period for an unlimited period •  School-based training (technical school training according to DQF 6) is to be maintained. Anyone who undergoes such a three-year training course should be entitled to the so-called Aufstiegs-BaföG (AFBG) and will not be subject to any sanctions.

gruene.explanation: Gruene does not explicitly mention higher salaries for teachers.

citations.content: Gruene: Together, we promote healthy working conditions, including recording working hours for teachers. In addition, more than 50,000 pupils leave school every year without a qualification – a risk of poverty and low participation. With a national strategy, we want to prevent school drop-outs through preventive and accompanying measures.

Gruene: Just like in the expansion of good all-day education and care services. We are expanding the range of mental health coaches in schools and we are committed to ensuring that the inclusion of all students in accordance with the UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities becomes a lived reality in all schools. A good school lunch is crucial for all-day offers and promotes nutrition and health literacy from an early age. This support should arrive where it is most needed. Instead of financing only according to the Königsstein key according to the number of inhabitants and financial strength, we want to align financing more closely with actual needs. We need closer cooperation between the federal government, the states and the municipalities in education policy. In doing so, we promote cooperation between schools, school supervisory authorities, school authorities and youth welfare, for example in regional education networks. Where constitutional restrictions currently prevent reliable and necessary investment in education, we will agree on common goals and viable solutions with the Länder in order to successfully overcome the major challenges in the education system together and also discuss new common tasks in the Basic Law. We want to abolish the ban on cooperation.
